The ketone group is the double-<br>bonded oxygen.]] A '''ketose''' is a [[sugar]] containing one [[ketone]] group per [[molecule]].<ref>{{cite book |title=Essentials of Carbohydrate Chemistry and Biochemistry |first=Thisbe K. |last=Lindhorst |publisher=Wiley-VCH |edition=1st|year=2007 |isbn=3-527-31528-4}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |title=Essentials of Carbohydrate Chemistry |publisher=Springer |first=John F. |last=Robyt |edition=1st |year=1997 |isbn=0-387-94951-8}}</ref> With three [[carbon]] atoms, [[dihydroxyacetone]] is the simplest of all ketoses and is the only one having no [[optical activity]]. Ketoses can [[isomer]]ize into an [[aldose]] when the carbonyl group is located at the end of the molecule. Such ketoses are [[reducing sugar]]s. ==List of ketoses== [[File:Family tree of d-ketoses.svg|thumbnail|Family tree of <small>D</small>-ketoses up to hexoses: dihydroxyacetone (1); <small>D</small>-erythrulose (2); <small>D</small>-ribulose (3a); <small>D</small>-xylulose (3b); <small>D</small>-psicose (4a); <small>D</small>-fructose (4b); <small>D</small>-sorbose (4c); <small>D</small>-tagatose (4d)]] All ketoses listed here are 2-ketones: * [[Triose]]s: [[dihydroxyacetone]] * [[Tetrose]]s: [[erythrulose]] * [[Pentose]]s: [[ribulose]], [[xylulose]] * [[Hexose]]s: [[fructose]], [[psicose]], [[sorbose]], [[tagatose]] * [[Heptose]]s: [[sedoheptulose]] * [[Octose]]s: [[D-manno-octulose|<small>D</small>-''manno''-octulose]] (the basis for [[3-Deoxy-D-manno-oct-2-ulosonic acid|KDO]]) * [[Nonose]]s: [[D-glycero-D-galacto-nonulose|<small>D</small>-''glycero''-<small>D</small>-''galacto''-nonulose]] (the basis for [[neuraminic acid]]) ==Qualitative reaction== General qualitative reaction for ketoses is [[Seliwanoff's test]]. ==See also== * [[Carbohydrate]] * [[Monosaccharide]] * [[Aldose]] == References == {{reflist|2}} {{Carbohydrates}} [[Category:Ketoses|*]] {{Biochem-stub}}
